final_answer.precision_note: Given data has 3-4 significant figures; final answer reported to 3 significant figures as 0.0702 mol dm-3.

method: First calculate moles of NaOH used: n(NaOH) = c × V = 0.150 mol dm-3 × (23.40/1000) dm3 = 0.00351 mol. From the equation H2SO4 + 2NaOH -> Na2SO4 + 2H2O, the mole ratio of H2SO4 to NaOH is 1:2, so moles of H2SO4 = 0.00351 / 2 = 0.001755 mol. The concentration of H2SO4 is c = n/V = 0.001755 mol / (25.00/1000) dm3 = 0.0702 mol dm-3.
checks: H2SO4 is diprotic acid requiring 2 moles NaOH per mole acid
Calculated concentration is reasonable for acid neutralization
